title: Daniel McAlister
text:
Daniel McAlister (born 22 August 1978 in <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>) is an <a href="Australian%20rules%20footballer">Australian rules footballer</a> notable for his brief appearance in the <a href="Australian%20Football%20League">Australian Football League</a> for the <a href="Essendon%20Football%20Club">Essendon Football Club</a>.
McAlister was born in <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>. Of <a href="M%C4%81ori%20people">Māori</a> heritage, he is one of few <a href="Maori%20Australian">Maori Australian</a>s in the history of the VFL/AFL. McAlister grew up playing <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> as a junior in <a href="Taranaki%20Region">Taranaki</a>. 
His family emigrated to <a href="Tasmania">Tasmania</a> when Daniel was 12, and after starting as a <a href="boundary%20umpire">boundary umpire</a> he played junior Australian rules in <a href="Smithton%2C%20Tasmania">Smithton</a> before moving to <a href="Hobart">Hobart</a> where he was selected in the Under 18 state team.
The 185 cm, 88 kg solidly built McAlister played just six games in three seasons between 1997 and 2002. Originally drafted with pick 5 in the 1996 AFL Draft, McAlister was delisted after playing just two senior games. Surprisingly, he was re-drafted in the <a href="2001%20AFL%20Draft">2001 AFL Draft</a>, picked up again by Essendon at pick #64. He was delisted at the end of 2002, after which he was signed to play for the <a href="Wodonga%20Raiders">Wodonga Raiders</a> in country <a href="Victoria%20%28Australia%29">Victoria</a>.
